cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts related to the distinction and interplay between reality and imagination in stories, including fact, fiction, and the underlying truth behind narratives.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The line between fact and fiction is often blurred... leaving listeners to ponder the truth behind the stories.

members.entity_description: Verified or objective truth contrasted with fiction in stories.
Invented or imagined content that blends with fact in urban legends.
Underlying reality or factual basis that listeners wonder about in stories.

cluster_classes.class_description: Real-world bases that can inspire or underpin narrative stories such as urban legends, including actual events and historical persons.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Some stories may be based on real events or historical figures.

members.entity_description: Actual occurrences that may form the basis for some urban legends.
Real people from history who may inspire or appear in certain stories.

cluster_classes.class_description: Narrative constructs (stories and legend variants) used to explain phenomena, convey caution, and evolve through collective creativity.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Stories and new forms of legends, often products of collective imagination, used to explain the unknown.

members.entity_name: new forms and variations of legends
members.entity_description: Altered versions of urban legends emerging as they spread geographically.
Shared inventive capacity of groups that generates many urban legends.

members.entity_name: stories used to explain the unknown
members.entity_description: Narratives created to make sense of unexplained or poorly understood phenomena.
Narratives passed down through generations and shared in communities worldwide.

args.new_name: Fact, Fiction, and Truth in Narratives
args.new_description: Concepts about how fact, fiction, and underlying truth interact within stories, focusing on narrative veracity and the reality–imagination boundary.
args.new_class_group: Narrative Truth, Sources, and Explanatory Roles
args.justification: Refines the label/description to explicitly frame this as epistemic aspects of stories and assigns a shared Class_Group connecting it to other classes about narrative origins and functions.

args.new_description: Real events and historical figures that serve as factual sources or inspirations for stories and urban legends.
args.new_class_group: Narrative Truth, Sources, and Explanatory Roles
args.justification: Clarifies that the class covers factual origins of narratives (events and people) and aligns it in a common Class_Group with related narrative-truth concepts.

args.new_description: Narrative forms—stories, legends, and their variations—used to explain the unknown, convey caution, and evolve through collective imagination.
args.new_class_group: Narrative Truth, Sources, and Explanatory Roles
args.justification: Tightens the label around the explanatory function of stories and assigns the same Class_Group to connect it with classes about narrative veracity and real-world sources.
